content.text: 1 Write the number sixteen thousand and sixty－two in figures．
2 Write three－quarters as
（a）a decimal
（b）a percentage．
3 Write down the value of
4 The diagram shows a line \(A B\) and a point \(P\) ．
（a）Measure the length of line \(A B\) in millimeters．
mm［1］
（b）Draw a line through point \(P\) that is perpendicular to line \(A B\) ．
5 Complete this statement.
10 weeks is days.
Shade \(\frac{2}{5}\) of the rectangle.
7 (a) Find the value of the reciprocal of \(\frac{1}{3}\).
(b) Write \(2^{-3}\) as a fraction.
8 Put one pair of brackets into each calculation to make it correct.
9 Write these fractions in order, starting with the smallest.
10 A cuboid has length 5 cm , width 2 cm and height 3 cm .
(a) Draw a net of the cuboid on the \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) grid.
(b) Work out the volume of the cuboid. Give the units of your answer.

table.html:
0
2
2
3
4
7

content.text: For these six numbers
(a) write down the mode
(b) work out the range
(c) work out the median
(d) work out the mean.
12 Tim has a method for multiplying a number by 99 . He shows his method for \(53 \times 99\).
Work out \(85 \times 99\) using Tim's method.
13 (a) A quadrilateral has the geometrical properties
- 4 equal length sides - 2 lines of symmetry
- rotational symmetry of order 2 .
Write down the mathematical name of this quadrilateral.
(b) Write down two geometrical properties of a rectangle.
The parallel sides of a trapezium have lengths 6 cm and 4 cm . The area of the trapezium is \(15 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
On the \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) grid, draw a trapezium with these lengths and area.
14 (a) Complete the table of values for \(y=(x+3)(x-2)\).

table.html:
\(x\)
-4
-3
-2
-1
0
1
2
3
\(y\)
6
-4
-4

content.text: (b) On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=(x+3)(x-2)\) for \(-4 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\).
(c) Write down the coordinates of the lowest point of the graph.
(d) Write down the equation of the line of symmetry of the graph.
(e) Use your graph to solve the equation \((x+3)(x-2)=3\).
15 Beth thinks of a positive number, \(n\). She squares \(n\) then subtracts 55 .
The answer is 9 .
Work out the value of \(n\).
16 The diagram shows a point \(P\) and three triangles, \(A, B\) and \(C\), on a \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) grid.
(a) Find the area of triangle \(B\).
\(\mathrm{cm}^{2}\)
(b) (i) Write down the coordinates of point \(P\).
(ii) Work out the coordinates of point \(P\) after a translation by the vector \(\binom{-20}{12}\).
(c) Draw the image of triangle \(A\) after a reflection in the line \(y=-1\).
(d) Describe fully the single transformation that maps
(i) triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(B\)
(ii) triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(C\).
17 By writing each number in the calculation correct to 1 significant figure, find an estimate for the value of
18 Find the highest common factor (HCF) of 66 and 110.
19 (a) \(P\) is a prime number.
Write down the value of \(P\) that satisfies the inequality \(13<P<19\).
(b) Write down the inequality represented on the number line.
Use set notation to describe the shaded region.
21 Work out \(2 \frac{7}{9} \times 1 \frac{1}{5}\).
Give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form.
22 The mass, \(m \mathrm{~kg}\), of a stone is 3.2 kg , correct to the nearest 100 g .
Complete this statement about the value of \(m\).
23 (a) Factorise.
(b) Expand and simplify.
24 Solve the simultaneous equations.
25 The diagram shows a shape made from two different semicircles, with the same centre.
The radius of the large semicircle is 7 cm . The radius of the small semicircle is 4 cm .
Work out the perimeter of the shape. Give your answer in terms of \(\pi\).
